text: Former docks of NDSM The Nederlandsche Dok en Scheepsbouw Maatschappij (NDSM) (Dutch: Netherlands dock and shipbuilding company), was a shipbuilding and repair company based in Amsterdam in the Netherlands, existing from 1946 to 1979. The company came in to existence after a merger between Nederlandsche Scheepsbouw Maatschappij (NSM) and the Nederlandsche Dok Maatschappij (NDM) both from Amsterdam. Customers included Koninklijke Paketvaart-Maatschappij (KPM), Koninklijke Nederlandsche Stoomboot Maatschappij (KNSM), Royal Dutch Shell and the Royal Netherlands Navy. ==Warships built== {| class="wikitable" |- ! width="200" |Name ! width="90" |Launched ! width="90" |Note |- ! colspan="3" | s |- | | 1953 | |- | | 1954 | |- | | 1955 | |- | | 1956 | |- ! colspan="3" | s |- | | 1965 | |- | | 1965 | |- | | 1967 | |- |} == External links == * History of NDSM * Category:Manufacturing companies based in Amsterdam Category:Shipbuilding companies of the Netherlands
title: Nederlandsche Dok en Scheepsbouw Maatschappij
